description:
Add client-side transfer service and hook for browser export/download of in-memory data.

Currently: `FileOps` in `packages/runtime/src/services/file.ts` handles file read operations. `useFileUpload` in `packages/runtime/src/hooks/file-upload.ts` bridges to React. `TransferFormat` and `ExportMeta` types will exist in `packages/types/src/transfer.ts` after server feature. No client-side export capability exists.

Deliverables:
1. Create `packages/runtime/src/services/transfer.ts` with `TransferOps` class extending `Context.Tag`:
   - `toCsv<T>(data: readonly T[], columns: readonly (keyof T)[]) => string` - generates CSV with header
   - `toJson<T>(data: readonly T[]) => string` - generates NDJSON
   - `download(content: string, meta: ExportMeta) => Effect<void>` - creates blob URL, triggers download, revokes URL
2. Create `TransferOpsLive` Layer implementing the service
3. Create `packages/runtime/src/hooks/transfer.ts` with `useTransfer` hook:
   - Uses `TransferOps` service via `Runtime.use()`
   - Returns `{ exportCsv, exportJson, isPending, error }` shape
   - Tracks async state like `useFileUpload`
4. Export from `packages/runtime` entry point
5. Pattern: mirror FileOps/useFileUpload structure exactly

Acceptance: `pnpm exec nx run runtime:typecheck` passes. `exportCsv([{a:1}], ['a'])` triggers browser download. Works offline.
title: Runtime TransferOps service
